clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Bacterial Contamination Rates Between Isolation and Non-isolation Rooms
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Contamination Rates of Medication Storage Cabinets Between Isolation and Non-isolation Rooms With Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus Aureus (MRSA)

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to determine if medication cabinets located outside of isolation rooms in hospitals and their contents, particularly medications and the delivery folders are at a higher risk of having harmful bacteria on them.

detailed_description.textblock:
Studies show high touch areas maybe contaminated with organisms such as Methicillinâ€”resistant Staphylococcus aureus(MRSA) and vancomycin-resistant enterococci. MRSA can live on hospital surfaces for 9-14 days. Patients in rooms that were previously MRSA isolation rooms are at higher risk for developing a hospital-acquired infection.
This study is to determine if medication cabinets located outside of MRSA isolation rooms and their contents, particularly medications and the pharmacy delivery folders are at a higher risk of having MRSA colonization on them. This study will use conventional methods to determine if MRSA colonization is present and compare results between non-isolation and isolation rooms. This will evaluate if alternate measures for the reduction of MRSA colonization are needed for the MRSA isolation rooms in regards to medication delivery and storage.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Hospital stay, an expected average of 14 days
primary_outcome.description: Swabbing of four areas of the medication cabinet will be performed (keypad, handle, medication folder and a medication). A Semi-quantitative sampling technique will be used to collect the samples. A sterile saline moistened sterile cotton tip swab will be used to swab the specified areas. The swabs will then be used to inoculate sheep blood agar plates in 4 quadrants. The plates will be incubated for 48 hours. The number of quadrants with growth will be identified. Individual colonies will be removed from the plate with an inoculation loop, then streaked onto a second sheep blood agar plate. The second plates will be incubated for 48 hours. The colonies will then be run through standard identification tests to determine if the colonies are MRSA or not. A comparison will be made between non-isolation and isolation rooms.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Hospital stay, an expected average of 14 days
secondary_outcome.description: Swabbing of four areas of the medication cabinet will be performed (keypad, handle, medication folder and a medication). A Semi-quantitative sampling technique will be used to collect the samples. A sterile saline moistened sterile cotton tip swab will be used to swab the specified areas. The swabs will then be used to inoculate sheep blood agar plates in 4 quadrants. The plates will be incubated for 48 hours. The number of quadrants with growth will be identified. A comparison between the sites of swabbing will be performed.

other_outcome.time_frame: Hospital stay, an expected average of 14 days
other_outcome.description: Swabbing of four areas of the medication cabinet will be performed (keypad, handle, medication folder and a medication). A Semi-quantitative sampling technique will be used to collect the samples. A sterile saline moistened sterile cotton tip swab will be used to swab the specified areas. The swabs will then be used to inoculate sheep blood agar plates in 4 quadrants. The plates will be incubated for 48 hours. The number of quadrants with growth will be identified. Individual colonies will be removed from the plate with an inoculation loop, then streaked onto a second sheep blood agar plate. The second plates will be incubated for 48 hours. The colonies will be categorized as gram negative, gram positive catalase negative, Gram positive coagulase negative Staphylococcus species or methicillin-sensitive Staphylococcus aureus. This will serve as a baseline epidemiology of the hospital and generate other possible hypotheses.

other_outcome.measure: Correlation between MRSA and active infection or colonization of patient
other_outcome.time_frame: Hospital stay, an expected average of 14 days
other_outcome.description: The patient from the same time frame in the rooms sampled and positive for MRSA colonization will be reviewed to determine if they had active infection or were previously colonized.

other_outcome.measure: Correlation between colonization of other positive organisms and active infection or colonization of patient
other_outcome.time_frame: Hospital stay, an expected average of 14 days
other_outcome.description: The patient from the same time frame in the rooms sampled and positive for non-MRSA colonization will be reviewed to determine if they had active infection or were previously colonized.

arm_group.description: Rooms that currently have a patient in them that are in isolation status due to MRSA
Rooms that have not been occupied by a patient in isolation due to MRSA for 14 days

study_pop.textblock: Inaptients at an academic medical center

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient rooms with isolation status for MRSA
- Patient rooms without isolation status for MRSA for 14 days
Exclusion Criteria:
- Rooms without medication cabinets directly outside the room
